input: Imagine a self-contained, hypothetical world with only the following conditions, and without any unmentioned factors or causal relationships: Playing card games has a direct effect on diabetes and lifespan. Smoking has a direct effect on diabetes and lifespan. Diabetes has a direct effect on lifespan. Smoking is unobserved. The overall probability of playing card games is 99%. For people who do not play card games, the probability of long lifespan is 49%. For people who play card games, the probability of long lifespan is 60%. Is long lifespan more likely than short lifespan overall?
